intro: Indosasa angustata, commonly known as the narrowleaf indosasa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
